audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Demonstrates market validation for new approach but doesn't specify the transformation itself
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Vague metrics - 'high-profile contracts' and 'standout' are qualitative without specifics
audited_claims.notes: Market validation signal but lacks specificity on transformation mechanics

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Strong revenue validation for new manufacturing approach - $1.65B represents significant market acceptance
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific financial metric from credible source
audited_claims.notes: Concrete evidence of commercial viability for transformed manufacturing model

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Core transformation thesis - additive manufacturing as fundamental shift from traditional rocket manufacturing
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Clear founding thesis from named company with specific timeline (since 2015)
audited_claims.notes: Establishes the fundamental business model transformation around 3D printing

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Explicitly describes paradigm shift - 'completely new approach' indicates transformation, not optimization
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Direct quote from company leadership describing strategic vision
audited_claims.notes: Clear articulation of manufacturing transformation philosophy

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Market expansion goal - enabling new customer segments (college students) represents new market creation
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific example of new market segment with clear value proposition
audited_claims.notes: Demonstrates intent to create new markets through cost transformation

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Dramatic structural change - reducing parts from 3,000 to 3 in engines represents fundamental manufacturing transformation
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Highly specific metrics with concrete example (engine parts reduction)
audited_claims.notes: Quantified evidence of manufacturing process transformation with dramatic impact

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Time compression goal (60 days) represents fundamental change in industry cycle times and economics
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific, measurable target that can be verified
audited_claims.notes: Ambitious cycle time target that would transform industry economics if achieved

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Quality improvement through design transformation - single-piece printing vs assembly represents new engineering approach
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific technical claim with engineering rationale
audited_claims.notes: Technical validation of how transformation improves product characteristics

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: General investor interest doesn't specify transformation impact
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Vague claim without specific funding amounts or investor names
audited_claims.notes: Too general - lacks specifics on funding amounts or strategic significance

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Technical validation that 3D-printed materials can perform in space applications - proves viability of transformation
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific test results from actual flight with clear technical outcome
audited_claims.notes: Critical proof point that the transformed manufacturing approach works in real conditions

tier_verification: Correctly classified as tier 1. This represents genuine transformation of rocket manufacturing from traditional assembly-based production to additive manufacturing, enabling new economics, faster cycles, and market expansion. The 'remove the AI/technology test' applies - without 3D printing, Relativity's business model and value proposition disappear entirely.
